description: Find out what level of Disclosure and Barring Service (DBS) check you can get for an employee you’re recruiting. Formerly a Criminal Records Bureau (CRB) check.

details.body:
Use this tool to find out what type of Disclosure and Barring Service (DBS) check you can get for your employee.

You can request a more detailed check for certain roles, for example in healthcare or childcare.

This tool is for companies that are registered in England or Wales and make decisions there about employing people. Find out if you can get a check in Scotland or get a check in Northern Ireland.

You can use this tool to see if you need a DBS check for a role you’re applying for. Your employer may also ask you to request your own basic check.

Checking for a management role

Use this tool to see what type of check you can request for the staff they manage. You can get the same type of check for the manager.

options.label: Healthcare or working in a hospital
Caring for or working with children (under 18) or working in a school
Working with elderly, ill or disabled adults

nodes.title: What type of role is it?

options.label: Working in a school but not in a teaching role, for example as a cleaner
Moderating an online chatroom or online media

nodes.title: What will the role with children involve?

options.label: Childminding (includes people living on childminding premises)
Working in a school, nursery, children's centre or home, detention service, young offender institution or childcare premises
Teaching, training or supervising children, but not in a school, nursery, children's centre or home, detention service, young offender institution or childcare premises
Helping ill or disabled children with eating or drinking, or helping ill, disabled or young children with washing, dressing or going to the toilet
Giving advice about physical, emotional or educational wellbeing, for example as a therapist
Fostering or adopting a child or working with fostered or adopted children

nodes.title: What will the teaching or caring involve?

nodes.body:
Answer ‘yes’ if the role involves any of the following:

  • working with children for more than 3 days in any 30 day period
  • ever working overnight (between 2am and 6am) where there may be face-to-face contact with children and the work involves teaching, training, supervising, advising, guiding or caring for children
nodes.title: Will the work be done frequently?

options.label: Yes, but the role is temporary

nodes.title: Will they get paid for the role? QUESTION NOT IN USE
Will they be supervised? QUESTION NOT IN USE

nodes.body:
Answer ‘yes’ if the role involves any of the following:

  • working with children for more than 3 days in any 30 day period
  • ever working overnight (between 2am and 6am) where there may be face-to-face contact with children
nodes.title: Will the work be done frequently?
Will they be supervised?

options.label: Doctor, nurse, pharmacist, optometrist or other healthcare professional or someone supervised by one while providing healthcare
Working with patients without supervision by a healthcare professional, for example reception staff, caterers, cleaners, volunteers
Providing first aid through a first aid organisation

nodes.title: What is the role?

options.label: Neither, for example working in a lab

nodes.title: Will the role involve working with children or adults?

nodes.body: If it’s a management role, choose the answer that describes the roles of the people they’ll be managing.

options.label: Helping ill, disabled or elderly adults with personal care
Looking after an adult's cash, bills or shopping because they're ill, disabled or elderly
Driving adults to where they get health or social care (but not taxi drivers)
Being appointed to represent an adult or conduct their affairs on their behalf
Teaching, advising or guiding adults, for example giving therapy
Working in a care home, but not in a caring role, for example as a cleaner
Moderating online chat or online media
Inspecting places where adults receive health or social care

nodes.title: What will the work involve?

nodes.body: Answer ‘yes’ if the role involves working with children for more than 3 days in any 30 day period.
nodes.title: Will the work be done frequently?

options.label: Someone working in the courts, prisons or probation services
Vet or someone employed by the RSPCA who is responsible for killing animals humanely
Someone applying for a licence or membership of an association

nodes.title: Who is the check for?

nodes.body:
Answer ‘yes’ if the role involves any of the following:

  • working with adults receiving care once a week or more
  • working with adults receiving care for more than 3 days in any 30 day period
  • ever working with adults receiving care overnight (between 2am and 6am)
nodes.title: Will the work be done frequently?

options.label: Other financial services professional (regulated by the Financial Conduct Authority)

nodes.title: What type of financial or legal professional is the check for?

options.label: A prison, detention or removal centre
HM Courts and Tribunals Service or in probation services

nodes.title: Where will they be working?

options.label: Regulated immigration adviser or someone working for one

nodes.title: What type of immigration worker is the check for?

options.label: Taxi driver or private hire vehicle licence
Membership of the Master Locksmiths Association

nodes.title: What type of licence or membership do they need?

options.label: Gambling Commission or National Lottery employee

nodes.title: Is the check for any of the following?
Is the role in a children's hospital?
Will the role involve contact with children?

options.label: An employer or organisation that provides services for the school
An employer or organisation that hires school premises but does not do any work for the school

nodes.title: Who will they work for?

options.label: Yes, but the role is temporary

nodes.title: Will they get paid for the role?

nodes.body: Answer ‘yes’ if the role involves working with children for more than 3 days in any 30 day period.

nodes.body:
Answer ‘yes’ if the role involves any of the following:

  • working with adults receiving care once a week or more
  • working with adults receiving care for more than 3 days in any 30 day period

Are the children fostered or adopted?

options.label: Living in a household with fostered children
Working in a foster agency with access to children or their personal information
Any other role with frequent visits to a household of fostered children

nodes.title: What will the role involve?

options.label: Adoptive parent or prospective adoptive parent
Living in a household with adopted children
Frequently visiting a household with adopted children

nodes.title: What does the role involve?

nodes.body:
Answer ‘yes’ if the role involves any of the following:

  • working with children for more than 3 days in any 30 day period
  • ever working overnight (between 2am and 6am) where there may be face-to-face contact with children
nodes.title: Will the work be done frequently?
What type of role is it?

nodes.body:
Answer ‘yes’ if the role involves any of the following:

  • working with children for more than 3 days in a 30 day period
  • ever working overnight (between 2am and 6am) where there may be face-to-face contact with children and the work involves teaching, training, supervising, advising, guiding or caring for children
nodes.title: Will the work be done frequently?

nodes.body:
Answer ‘yes’ if the role involves any of the following:

  • working with adult prisoners for more than 3 days in any 30 day period
  • ever working face-to-face with adult prisoners overnight (between 2am and 6am)
  • working with adult prisoners at least once a week
nodes.title: Will the work be done frequently?
Is it in England or Wales?

nodes.body: Answer ‘yes’ if the role involves working with children for more than 3 days in any 30 day period.

Placeholder outcome
Placeholder outcome

nodes.body:
Being a childminder is regulated activity, which means some people are barred from doing this role.

For childminders you can get both:

  • an enhanced check
  • a children’s barred list check

People who live or work with the childminder

You can also request these checks for anyone 16 or over who lives or works on childminding premises.
nodes.title: You can request an enhanced check with a children's barred list check

nodes.body:
Find out how to request:

  • an enhanced check
  • a children’s barred list check

This is a regulated activity role, which means some people are barred from doing it.

Managers

You can request the same check for a manager of someone doing this role.
nodes.title: You can request an enhanced check with a children's barred list check

nodes.body:
Find out how to request an enhanced check.

Managers

You cannot request a check for a manager of someone doing this role.
nodes.title: You can request an enhanced check without a barred list check

nodes.body:
This role does not seem to be eligible for a standard or enhanced check. But you can still request a basic check.

You can either do this for the applicant or ask them to get their own check.

This tool does not cover every role. Contact DBS if you’re still not sure what type of check you can request.

DBS customer services
customerservices@dbs.gov.uk
Telephone: 03000 200 190
Minicom: 03000 200 192
Monday to Friday, 8am to 6pm
Saturday, 10am to 5pm
Find out about call charges
